description: From Latin pharmacopola  +‎ -ist, from Ancient Greek φαρμακοπώλης (pharmakopṓlēs), from φάρμακον (phármakon, “drug, charm, enchantment”) + -πώλης (-pṓlēs, “-seller, -monger”). Doublet of pharmacopole.

entries.meaning: (archaic or historical) Synonym of pharmacist: a person who sells medicine, an apothecary.
